root.name: Mario's Cement Factory
root.description: Overview Mario's Cement Factory is a title that originated as part of Nintendo's Game Watch series of handheld LCD games of the 1980s. In this game, the player controls Mario, who must ensure that the cement coming from the factory is successfully poured into the waiting trucks. Mario's Cement Factory was remade as a downloadable game for Nintendo DSiWare and was released in North America on March 22, 2010. The game costs 200 Nintendo Points. Gameplay Two cement trucks sit at the bottom of the screen, each underneath two cement tanks. The player must run back and forth between the four tanks and empty the upper tanks into the lower tanks, and the lower tanks into the trucks. If any of the tanks overflow, the excess cement will spill and hit the truck driver below. Complicating matters are the two elevators in the center of the screen. One elevator goes up, and the other down. Riding the elevator too high or too low will also end the game.
